reviews.review_msg: Honestly, awful

She was a terrible prof, her classes filled with useless filler and crap...Everything taught was useless for the essays or the massive essay final exams....No help for what was expected of me...Everyone i knew skipped about half the time, I stayed there and was bored out of my skull.  NEVER AGAIN!!!
Dr. Davis really cares bout her students.

Good book selection, but not enough time spent on each, I felt. Fair marker. I didn't really feel as though going to lectures was really necessary, at least from a marking perspective. I was surprised that this course wasn't just a recap of grade ten english. ended up learning some new things.
meh alright, but repetitive really really repeittive

Has to be the most boring lectures I've ever attended at SFU. Absolutely wonderful guy though. One on one, he makes everything clear and is extremely helpful in getting you to improve your writing. Such a sweetheart and is very respectful of all of his students. I don't think I heard one negative thing come from his mouth all semester.

This prof knows his stuff!  I dunno if he makes it up or not, but his lechures are so interesting to hear.  The final is not hard, and the books he picks for you is quite interesting.  He doesn't make you read too much, and he encourages feedback and class discussions.  Overall, he's a great prof!

Very enthusiactic ! Helpful and tries to engage people into the conversations in tutorial.  Very funni, and is able to make everything clear, simple, and straight to the point.  Isn't biased when marking, u just need to make a strong argument, and not necessarily in favour of his ideas or thoughts.

He's absolutely ADORABLE! Lectures are very well organized and he's so enthusiastic! ALways smiley and values all student opinions. Interesting choice of works and intertextual references. Incorporated a lot of neat films clips and works of art! My TA was pretty brutal though on 1st essay. BEWARE!
Excited about course content, adorable, and acts like everything you say is the most important thing he's ever heard.  A good teacher for an elementary course.

Being in Science, i'd have to say, this was the one class i DID look forward to. David's very enthusiastic about what he teaches, which makes things all the more interesting for the class. The reading was (mostly) very good, didnt feel like homework at all. It's a pretty easy couse, well worth it!

Lectures provide some insight on different literary terms however not as insightful as i had hoped.  If you are coming from a strong eng 12 background this is an easy A.  IF you took IB english or AP english...you will SAIL through this course no problem..just watch out for MLA style guidelines
awesome prof..very clear on everything, making the class that much easier
GOOD teacher.  I was never good at english, but he makes me WANT to go to class :)
No Comments
SUCH a good teacher.  very clear on his subjects and is a very interesting person over all.  love his class to death, so much fun.  and he makes the teaching seem like a hobby, instead of a job.
His class was enjoyable and gives good background information on the reading material. Only gave reading assignments for homework and that's about it.
ok

He was really passionate about all the topics, but it's sometimes upsetting that his students aren't as enthusiastic because it was an introductory course that students can take for their writing credits. Overall, very very nice, and very helpful, and well, just about everything that's been said, haha.
Not only is she is extremely engaging, she is crystal clear and makes you think about things in a new light.  If you have her for a prof., consider yourself lucky.
She has a hot passion for literature. She portrays the beauty of lierature herself.

Very helpful and engaging. Encourages questions and promotes discussion in class. Tutorials can be interesting if you choose to participate and keep up with readings! The books we read were really interesting and though-provoking and overall it was a really fun class if you actually keep up with everything and participate. Pretty easy B+ at least.
I don't know about you guys but this class was just sooooo boring for me. I won't ever take a class with her again.
Susan was a kind and articulate professor. She made class content interesting and spoke with a charismatic tone. Definitely take this class with her!
shes good and nice but its not necessary to go to class. tutorials are very mandatory but its fairly easy. and entertaining. she always shows youtube clips.

All of the work is graded by your TA. My TA was pretty great and was one of the best for my first semester. English is pretty subjective though, so it can be a hit or miss. Lectures are not uploaded, so be prepared to go to class. I missed quite a few classes since it was 8:30, but I managed a B.
tough marker but knowledgeable. i wouldn't take this course with her or any other.

She's a great prof! She has taught me a lot literature wise. I do have to say that for a 100 level class, it is really heavy. She chose 4 great books for the semester and I found it hard to keep up with the readings (also had short stories) since some of them are long-800 pages. She is a strict marker but a kind, engaging, and understanding prof.
Simply put, she is the worst prof ever. Never take a class with her! She marks excruciatingly hard and is so boring
She is pretty nice but quite strict and thorough on marking in-class writings.!
No Comments
Boring

Super anal about plagiarism, had her for tutorial leader as well and she would make you sign a consent form about the issue of "I will not cheat". She has high expectations, 1st year students will probably have a hard time in her class coming out of gr.12
Her expectation are ridiculous! Unless you are a very talented writer, you would hate this class. If you are a decent writer, then this class will smash your self esteem and your GPA.

God she's awful. Not to be rude, but she makes the class way more difficult than it needs to be. I have taken other 1st year English classes before, but she has set the bars way too high in her class when it comes to the Essays. If you essay has the quality of a B paper and 1 quality of a C paper u end up with a C for the paper and thats that!
Great class if you love reading like I do. TA's are super helpful. Del Vento is quirky, kinda sorta crazy, but makes class fun. Assignments and exams are fair. Good 100 level english to take.

she was good prof and i dont know what the other people are talking about she paying student to give her good ratings. In my opinion if you focus during lecture you do not even need to read the books. In exams as long you mention the points she mentions in class you score good. Overall good class. P.S. try not to get into her tut section.

Worst prof ever for an introductory writing course! I loved English in high-school and I knew it wouldn't be as easy but honestly, she marks way too hard!! Lectures are irrelevant and she's not clear about what she wants on essays. Even went to her office hours, didn't help much. WORST EVER!! :@

Probably one of the best professor's at SFU. I looked forward to her class. She is extremely nice, loves to help, interactive, and a little quirky. There are a lot of readings but i really enjoyed the class. Dont pass the chance of being in her class.
She is awesome! It's not easy stuff, but you can learn a lot from her! I have never had a professor who is as responsible as she is. Always there to help you! Best class I've ever had!
he is great!!! the course is easy, with easy marking, easy final and the stories are pretty good!!

The only reason to come to his lectures are his truly bizzare comments; if the man didn't have tenure, I don't think he'd survive. He's quite fair with his marking and assignments, though. Woody Allen lookalike.

stories on picking out urinated toilet paper out of the urinal as a hobbby... just another day in St. Pierre's lecture (most definitely preparing me for the real world). Hey if you want a lecture you wont be worried about missing this is the class for you

Very inspiring and intellegent man. Relates lecture material to his childhood and publications, all of which are very interesting. Sometimes says bizarre things in class that cracks everyone up. Seems to really care for his students
He's a funny guy. Weird humour and very inspiring. Very nice.

I rarely attended lecture and was still able to pull a good grade just by reading the novels and writing the papers. Easy course, great novel selections, but fell asleep in lecture when I did attend. Did not touch upon anything not covered excessively in high school. Her views on the novels were not open to discussion.

Reading is very heavy for a first year eng class. But assignments and such are straight forward. If you don't understand what she wants seriously go ask her or your TA otherwise the marks for your papers will tell. Easy final.

Really enjoyed this course, not too difficult at all, just keep up with the readings and study the notes for the final exam.  Very helpful w/ improving essays, doing close reading, etc.  Very nice, definitely will be taking another course with her...
Enjoy his classes
He is a very good instructor. He is patient and makes you feel comfortable in his lecture. If you find difficulties on writing essays, he can give you helpful advice.
The best prof I've had so far(very serious)! Would definitely take more classes with him!
Very good and helpful and kind professor!!! Funny and interesting!!!! You won't feel sleepy on his class!!!!!
One of the best profs. Really helpful+is ok with extensions of the essay.

I took his course in FIC, and that was hilarious!!!Steve helped me to improve my english writing skills + you can always ask him about slang (I mean if you r not native speaker xD) and "other" different words. If you need help he will help you as much as he can. Finally, he is a really nice man!
nice professor, hard course

prof was pretentious. lectures were basically just a platform for her to show off her so-called superior intellectual prowess. assignments were unclear and marking was unfair (contrapuntal readings???) TAs were nice but did not know what they were talking about.

too much readings. DONT fall behind in this class cuz its at least 3 short stories per week. 3 5oo-word essays, one revision (1200-1500 word). easy-pie :) but the final was hard. it took me almost 3 hours - had to write 2-500 word essays and 5-250 word paragraphs. colette is VERY genuine and i will definitely take more classes taught by her!

Had to do a LOT of reading, usually 4 short stories every week. Lecture topics sometimes seemed pointless, but most of the time they were quite interesting. Had to write three 500-word essays and a revision of one, and the final exam was quite open-ended. Overall it was an easy-going course, aside from all the reading.
Good teacher, nice person but lectures were often full of pointless untestable information. A fairly easy class and an easy A.
No Comments
this is my favorite class - collette is an amazing lecturer and her ta's are awesome too. you won't regret taking this class!

Prof colligan is really nice-- and well spoken. Her lectures are rather quite interesting, and aren't boring at all. I love the choice of books she made, from "Curious Incident of the Dog in ...." to "Maus I, and Maus II." The Ta's are awesome too! She's just great... and good looking too:)
No Comments
very intelligent, well prepared. she made friction different than i expected. although the inclass essay was pretty frightening, if u get an easy TA, you'll be fine.

She's an adorable professor; when I grow up I desire to be just like her. She has truly inspired me; her lectures are amazing. She marks fair and she's extremely kind and ready to help you. If you enjoy english, this is a mandatory class. You'll love it.

Had Eng 101 a couple of years ago, and am desperately trying to get into more of her classes. She's the best professor I have ever had in my three years. Very interesting, very clear. I had her as a TA for my class as well, she was so friendly and nice. Get into her classes if you can!
this was supposed to be an intro to fiction class not a class about the political sinificance of the books.
really easy course, not alot of work.  she often uses a number of intelligent words that most people don't understand, but really it doesnt matter anyways
Prof doesnt know what shes talking about. Over use of the words erotic, fettish and variations of the word. She says "um" alot and it gets annoying...

Dr. Colligan is great at keeping the class interesting. She introduces movie clips, soundbytes, photos...everything that could possibly suppliment the novels you study. The best class I had first year by far.
Best class and best professor I have ever had at SFU. the only lectures/classes that i ever enjoyed going to - because she made them so interesting! i love colleen!

Definitely one of my favourite profs. Her lectures are interesting and draw from all kinds relevant material outside the books. She is very approachable and helpful and her seminars are interesting and informative. Could you really ask for more?

The assignment outlines were vague and can lead to misinterpretation, make sure you talk to your TA for clarity! We had 3 books, a manga, and a handful of short stories to read. make sure you stay on top of your readings, she asks part. qus. in class. keep notes while reading, tab pages you like, needed for assignments.
terrible professor and novels.
Lectures were absolutely unbearable. Eng 101 isn't even english, its aboriginal studies. The books were all boring and some difficult to understand. TA's marking was unfair. Stay away, seriously.
Didnt really get much out of her lectures. Also, I didnt know shed make all the books native books. That wasn't really fair. Don't recommend this prof
Easy prof.. knows how to teach.. the slides suck, and you have to pay attention to what shes saying and take notes. Overall if you attend lectures and pay attention youll do good.

Easily the worst professor I've ever had out of my three years at various universities. The course pretends to be an intro to English fiction, but really is a Native studies course. More propaganda than English study in her poorly communicated lectures. Just miserable, truly miserable.

She means well and geniunely enjoys her subject, but seems to be a poor speaker & takes forever to make her points. If you're strong in English there is zero need to attend lectures; read books, do essays, and you're golden. She ran my tutorial as well, and was no more useful there. Emphasizes her own 'business' too much, as if her students aren't.
Overall a pretty excellent prof. Explains stories well, gives you more to think about in the stories and extremely helpful when you need further explanation.
worst class i have ever taken. the TAs markings are soooo harsh. Novels used in this course is so boring that i fell asleep numerous times while reading

He is the first person I have met in the academic arena with such bad personality traits (arrogant, degrading, un-communicatable). To say the unmentioned nicely: very un-Canadian. He did not provide a clear answer to any of my many questions, he simply grinds the student by brutal marking and degrading email responses.

If you expect an ordinary introduction english course DONT TAKE HIM. He is quiet biased even though he repeatedly states he isn't. Fortunately my TA was very helpful and kinda cute. Even my cute TA doesn't get Odgen's point some of the time. The reading were not so bad, a lot but some were interesting. Marking was towards the harder side.

First of all, I registered for English 101, but what I got instead was religion 101. The course was way too focused on religion. He did not give any info about the final and we had to read the Da Vinci Code for class. Avoid this course and prof if you are actually hoping to learn something about fiction.

Given the fact that he had to pick up our class where another prof left off,Dr. Ogden was awesome. He marked fairly, picked interesting novels, and challenged us to become better writers, while still offering lots of help. Don't be afraid to ask him for help-he will gladly give it to you if you just ask!!

Dreadful.  He told us for weeks in lecture to "RELAX" - that those who came to lecture and read the materials thoroughly would be fairly rewarded.  Then he proceeded to create the most unfair final exam imaginable.  This man should not deal with students, or any other human life forms.  Ever.  He is completely incompetent as an instructor.

If you have this guy... get ready to take a whole lot of jumbled notes and page numbers because he jumps around like an energizer bunny.  The midterm essay was pretty easy, but the final was pretty long! (10 def. 3 paragraph answers, 5 matching, and then 2 essays) in just 3 hours!... yeah.. overall... not too bad..
No Comments

The final exam was pretty long.  Be ready to write a lot! (In total 5 identify author/text, 10 definitions, 3 significance paragraphs max 2 pages each and then 2 essays 300-500 words each) His lecture notes do help... although there's a lot of redundancy and he jumps around a lot... just re-read the notes and it'll make sense.
Dreadful.

please, i ask just one favour...before enrolling in one of his classes, carefully consider the following: 
 http://photos1.blogger.com/hello/183/3075/320/1.jpg
 (east meets west, and the world was never the same again)
hes an awesome prof! fair in marking..gives good notes.. good class!

sasha's the best prof i've had. going into the class i really didn't like her sense of humour, but after getting together and asking her tons of ques one on one, she's extremely helpful and super nice! very easy course if you know what the prof and t.a are looking for in the essays. sooo easy to get good marks if you just read the books assigned!!

Sasha is one of the best profs i've had in uni, serious! extremely friendly, very funny and fun to listen to. I'd recommend for you to talk to her, whether you're acing the course, or failing it, she'll definitely help you to improve. awesome teacher!
whatever dude. good prof, good lectures. seems to have a thing a against slackers but cool with everyone else.

Carolyn is incredible! I took this course as a W requirement with very little interest in studying English, but Carolyn completely changed my mind. She's cheerful, energetic and engaging. She really cares about her class and the books she uses - and she gives out tons of great essay topics in class, if you're listening! Kind person and great prof.
No Comments
A guy who makes five times what you'll ever make dropping poetry for the 99%. Drop the class. Start again. We need a new culture.

Looks like a prof from the waist up (sweater vests and shirts), a skater boy from the waist down (cargo pants and vans)...likes to tell the story of the first time he got high with his brother and sister, when he was 4.
excellent prof, makes lectures exciting, reading material was very interesting not the normal dull english books
No Comments
Great person, great prof, go to his lectures, ace the final exam
He was interesting and comprehensive when he talked about the novels.
really cool, great for first years...should pick better books tho.
Great prof, EXCELLENT in tutorials.  Inspiring and stimulating.
GREAT teacher! so interesting, and he's a poet!!
very good prof to have for first year english
Great first year teacher and very friendly
He is the best prof. in the world. Very nice and very helpful. More than anything else he is very very very nice person. love the way he teaches and the way he helps. god bless him!
He is just too good....Awesome teacher....:)
